description: After a tense discussion at the bar, a firmware ‘hotfix’ is quietly sent to key city terminals, enabling acceptance of paper records as temporary IDs in blackout districts.
Word spreads that paper records work at select terminals; neighborhood memory markets spring up, with retired clerks and residents exchanging old files and validation letters.
Lines form around manual record booths; city leaders face pressure as hundreds regain jobs and homes, fueling a grassroots revolt against digital-only governance.
